questions.question: A __________ is a defined list of characters where each character has a fixed binary code; one common example is _______ _______ _______ for _______ _______.
questions.answer: character set; American Standard Code for Information Interchange

questions.question: Match each term to its description.

pairs.ASCII: A character set that assigns a unique code to common characters
pairs.Unicode: Supports a much wider range of characters and languages than ASCII
pairs.Binary: Form used by computers to store and process text

questions.question: What is the main advantage of Unicode over ASCII?
options: Unicode supports a much wider range of characters and languages
questions.answer: Unicode supports a much wider range of characters and languages

questions.question: What is the effect of increasing the sample rate?
options: Captures the sound less accurately and reduces the file size
Captures the sound more accurately and increases the file size
Leaves accuracy and file size unchanged
Decreases accuracy and increases the file size
questions.answer: Captures the sound more accurately and increases the file size

questions.question: The sample rate is the number of samples taken each second, measured in [____].
Match each term to its description.

pairs.Sampling with an analogue to digital con: Measures the sound wave at set intervals and approximate amplitude values are stored in binary
pairs.Sample rate: Number of samples taken each second
pairs.Sample resolution: Number of bits used to store each sample

questions.question: What is a pixel?
options: The number of samples taken each second in a sound file
The smallest image unit in a bitmap
A list of characters where each has a fixed binary code
A measurement of audio amplitude stored in binary
questions.answer: The smallest image unit in a bitmap

questions.question: Match each term to its description.

pairs.Image metadata: Information such as width and height that helps software reconstruct the image correctly when displayed
pairs.Image resolution: Number of pixels in the image; higher values show more detail and increase the file size
pairs.Colour depth: Number of bits used for each pixel; more bits allow more possible colours and increase the file size

questions.question: Image resolution is the number of pixels in the image, given by its [____] multiplied by its height.
